Belief.definition: An acceptance that a statement is true or that something exists.

Belief-concept.definition: An acceptance that a statement is true or that something exists.

Conviction-belief.definition: A firmly held belief or opinion.

Doubt-concept.definition: A feeling of uncertainty or lack of conviction.

Faith.definition: Complete trust or confidence in someone or something.

Opinion.definition: A view or judgment formed about something, not necessarily based on fact or knowledge.

Suspicion.definition: A feeling or thought that something is possible, likely, or true.

Trust-concept.definition: Firm belief in the reliability, truth, ability, or strength of someone or something.

Agreement.definition: A negotiated and typically legally binding arrangement between parties.

Agreement-concept.definition: Harmony or accordance in opinion or feeling.

Bargain.definition: An agreement between two or more people or groups as to what each will do for the other.

Contract.definition: A written or spoken agreement, especially one concerning employment, sales, or tenancy, that is intended to be enforceable by law.

Deal.definition: An agreement entered into by two or more parties for their mutual benefit.

Pact.definition: A formal agreement between individuals or parties.

Settlement.definition: An official agreement intended to resolve a dispute or conflict.

Treaty.definition: A formally concluded and ratified agreement between countries.

Truce.definition: An agreement between enemies or opponents to stop fighting or arguing for a certain time.

Rule.definition: A set of explicit or understood regulations or principles governing conduct.

Law-concept.definition: The system of rules which a particular country or community recognizes as regulating the actions of its members.

Policy.definition: A course or principle of action adopted or proposed by a government, party, business, or individual.

Precedent.definition: An earlier event or action that is regarded as an example or guide to be considered in subsequent similar circumstances.

Principle.definition: A fundamental truth or proposition that serves as the foundation for a system of belief or behavior.

Procedure.definition: An established or official way of doing something.

Regulation.definition: A rule or directive made and maintained by an authority.

Rule-concept.definition: One of a set of explicit or understood regulations or principles governing conduct within a particular activity or sphere.

Standard.definition: A level of quality or attainment.

Structure.definition: The arrangement of and relations between the parts or elements of something complex.

Arrangement.definition: The action, process, or result of arranging or being arranged.

Form-concept.definition: The visible shape or configuration of something.

Format.definition: The way in which something is arranged or set out.

Framework.definition: A basic structure underlying a system, concept, or text.

Hierarchy.definition: A system in which members of an organization or society are ranked according to relative status or authority.

Network.definition: A group or system of interconnected people or things.

Order-arrangement.definition: The arrangement or disposition of people or things in relation to each other.

Organization.definition: The structure or arrangement of related or connected items.

Structure-concept.definition: The arrangement of and relations between the parts or elements of something complex.

System.definition: A set of things working together as parts of a mechanism or an interconnecting network.
